column4: what command do i have to issue in order to open another xsrv
Just give it IP Address:server number. Since I guess you want it on your local machine leave IP Address blank, then since you have a server running on :0 use :1 instead
To give regular users permission to run programs on that server you may want to use "X -ac :1"
thanks a lot. but this only gets me a grey screen with a cursor. how can i run applications on this?
OK, go back to another terminal
run "export DISPLAY=localhost:1" then run whatever program you want, like gnome-session or startkde
You can actually use System>Quit>Switch User to start up another login screen, which may be what you are after
